intro: Adicea anisophylla, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. Its leaves are alternate and usually have a velvety texture. Adicea anisophylla thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats.
